lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after my cat _Cookie_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/cookie/Cookie.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Cookie.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
* Main class for the Cookie task management chatbot.
* Handles interaction between the UI, Storage, Parser and Tasks.
* Constructs new instance of Cookie application.
* Initializes Ui and Storage and loads tasks from saved file.
* @param filePath Path of file to load tasks from.
* Runs the main loop to run the Cookie chatbot.
* Process user commands and handles program termination.
* Calls the function to start the main program loop.
* Represents a custom exception class for the Cookie program.
* Thrown when errors specific to this program occur like
* Constructs a new CookieException with the specified error message
* @param message Message detailing cause of error.
* Checks the users input matches the required format and

* prints the corresponding output, updates the task list,
* @param listOfTasks List of tasks currently stored.
* @param ui The ui instance used to print relevant messages to user.
* @param storage The storage instance used to save the current list in a text file
* @param fullInput The complete user input string.
* @return True if input is equal to "bye", false otherwise.
* @throws CookieException If input does not follow required format.
TaskList listOfTasks, Ui ui, Storage storage, String fullInput) throws CookieException {
throw new CookieException("Please specify which task you would like to mark.");
throw new CookieException("Please specify which task you would like to unmark.");
throw new CookieException("Please specify which task you would like to delete.");
throw new CookieException("Please provide a description for your todo task.");
throw new CookieException("Please provide deadline in the format: {Description} /by {Day}");
Task newEvent = new Event(description, from, to);
throw new CookieException("Please specify task to find.");
throw new CookieException("Sorry! I'm not too sure what you mean!");
* Manages the saving and loading of tasks to and from the text file respectively.
/** File path to text file where the list data is stored */
* Creates new instance of Storage with specified file path.
* @param filePath Path to specified text file where data is to be stored.
* Converts each task in the list to the save format.
* Writes this new list of tasks in saved format to text file.
* @param listOfTasks List of tasks to save to specified text file.
System.out.println("Encountered an error when attempting to save the file.");
* Loads list of tasks from saved file.
* Converts each task in the loaded list to the original format.
* Creates new directory and file if file is not present.
* @return List of tasks loaded from specified text file.
* @throws CookieException If there is an error converting task from stored format to original format.
* Represents a task with a specific deadline.
* Adds date and time functionality to base Task class.
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_FOR_INPUT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_FOR_OUTPUT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HHmm");

public Deadline(String description, String by) throws CookieException {
throw new CookieException("Please specify date in the following format: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
* Converts deadline task into format for saving.

private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_FOR_INPUT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_FOR_OUTPUT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HHmm");

* Converts event task into format for saving.

* Displays welcome message when user first launches the application.
System.out.println("Hey there! My name is Cookie");
* Displays goodbye message when the application is terminated.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays all the tasks in the current list of tasks.

System.out.println("Great! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays message indicating the task has been marked as not done.
System.out.println("Alright. I've marked this task as not done yet:");

public void showDelete(Task taskToBeDeleted, int taskCounter) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskCounter + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays message indicating the todo task has been added to the list of tasks.

System.out.println("Now you have " + taskCounter + " tasks in the list.");
